result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Eckels III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any sentence the Defendant is currently serving, if any.

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Court grants 42 days credit.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit. To be paid joint/several with co-actor.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 06/30/2022 Plea/Sentencing Hearing in front of Judge Schimel, filed by Court Reporter Barbara Dassow

ADDRESS INFO for James H Eckels III
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Acknowledgement of Transport to: Dodge Correctional Institution filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

10:30 AM Defendant James H Eckels in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Atty Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count #6. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count #6.
Repeater enhancer struck.
Count #7 is dismissed and read-in. 

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED AS TO FIREARMS AND VOTING RESTRICTIONS

At the time of sentencing, the state will be requesting buy money in the amound of $3710.00, joint/several with co-actors, to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit.

State is requesting that the court order a PSI. 
Defense is objecting. 
Court explains what a PSI is to the Defendant. Defendant confirms that he does not want a PSI. 
Court denies request for PSI and will proceed with sentencing today. 

State makes sentencing recommendation. Atty Jensen makes sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 6 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 3 YEARS
Extended Supervision: 3 YEARS
42 Days Credit.
Consecutive to any sentence the Defendant is currently serving if any

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be given if not already done

BUY MONEY:  $3,710.00, joint/several with co-actors, to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit (to be paid before costs or fines);

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

DEFENDANT TO BE TRANSFERRED TO DCI FORTHWITH  Check Case scheduled for August 17, 2022.
